newsitem.title: ITALY: Prodi sees Italian CPI falling in coming months.
newsitem.headline: Prodi sees Italian CPI falling in coming months.

text.p: Italian inflation will come in at three percent year-on-year in October and should fall further in the following months, Prime Minister Romano Prodi said.

"Consumer inflation growth has passed from 4.5 percent year-on-year in April to 3.0 percent in October, with good prospects for a further reduction in the coming months," Prodi told a conference of Italian agricultural employers.

Data from 10 Italian cities published earlier this week pointed to inflation falling to 3.0 percent year-on-year in October from 3.4 percent in September. Some economists suggested inflation might even fall to 2.9 percent this month.
Final inflation data are due in the first week of November. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
